column4: Is there anything I have to do to get my torrent downloads running faster? Normally I used to get like 100+ kb/sec on my win machine, and on ubuntu I only get like 5-10kb/sec
did you setup the upload/download/connection limit?
yea it's still going uber slow
downloading the same file? or a different file?
same file
but this keeps happening on any torrent i try to run
i have firestarter filewall running, but i've opened the ports for bittorent
port forwarding take a lot of time...
on my windows PC, when I ran torrents with my same network config i got better speeds, yes there is a firewall on, and i've added the torrent ports to the accept policy
is there a better torrent program i should be using?
what kind of firewall?
firestarter
no on ubuntu
my unbuntu computer is connected to my router, and is set to be the DMZ host, and has firestarter firewall running on it
you just didn't answer my question, nvm
is there a better torrent program u can recommend?
i just dont get what my windows pc has to do with anything? it was running norton A/V 2005
the same client as you use in  Windows...
I use ABC client in windows... is the linux version of that any good?
nvm... if you don't/cannot understand the question
because the linux version is from 2003? i dunno i thought it was kinda old...
alright
thanks
